title: Folding Fork And Spoon Bowl, ca. 1690
markings:
Stamped handle: FW
Stamp of block numbers (?) on reverse side
inscribed:
On fork: VI (engraved)

On spoon: VI (engraved)
dimensions:
L x W (fork): 15.5 x 1.9 cm (6 1/8 x 3/4 in.)
L x W (spoon bowl): 6.3 x 4.2 cm (2 1/2 x 1 5/8 in.)
creditline: The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg
description:
Fork has three curved tines, flat tapering handle with bowl-shaped end, scrolled shoulders. Hinged at neck, faceted sliding lock bar. Octagonal handle with engraved fish-bone decoration and floral design, baluster shaped top.

Oval spoon bowl, engraved on back with symmetrical floral design. Two slots on the back of bowl to attach the fork.

exhibitions.title: Feeding Desire: Design and the Tools of the Table, 1500-2005

tombstone.epitaph:
Folding Fork And Spoon Bowl, ca. 1690.
ca. 1690. Silver. The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg. 1985-103-77-a,b.
